          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

            Issue 1235031: Crash in glCompressedTexImage2D by glPixelStorei
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1235031: Crash in glCompressedTexImage2D by glPixelStorei
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      sjh...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/1969631125" title="sjh...@gmail.com"><!---->sjh...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      sjh...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->sjh...@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on 
      Sat, Jul 31, 2021, 8:21 AM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Sat, Jul 31, 2021, 8:21 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Sat, Jul 31, 2021, 8:21 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
          </small>
        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1235031: Crash in glCompressedTexImage2D by glPixelStorei
          </h1>
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>

nullptr &amp;&amp; imageSize &lt; 0)<!----></span><br>    {<span class="line"><!---->    {<!----></span><br>        // Checks are not required<span class="line"><!---->        // Checks are not required<!----></span><br>        return true;<span class="line"><!---->        return true;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br><br>    // ...the data would be unpacked from the buffer object such that the memory reads required<span class="line"><!---->    // ...the data would be unpacked from the buffer object such that the memory reads required<!----></span><br>    // would exceed the data store size.<span class="line"><!---->    // would exceed the data store size.<!----></span><br>    const InternalFormat &formatInfo = &amp;&amp; !computeDepthPitch(size.height, state.imageHeight, rowPitch, &amp;depthPitch))<!----></span><br>    {<span class="line"><!---->    {<!----></span><br>        return false;<span const<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>    // Compressed images do not use pack/unpack parameters.<span class="line"><!---->    // Compressed images do not use         Thanks for the report! The crash is inside of a failing ASSERT call, which is only enabled in testing builds. I put in a CL that removes the ASSERT here: <span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report! The crash is inside of a failing ASSERT call, which is only enabled in testing builds. I put in a CL that removes the ASSERT here: <!----></span>http://crrev.com/c/3064986<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://crrev.com/c/3064986"><!---->http://crrev.com/c/3064986<!----></a> - it doesn't seem like a correct debugging check. Reporter: when reporting errors I recommend double-checking ASSERT-based crashes as the bug might be the ASSERT itself. You can specify "dcheck_always_on = false" in Release builds to turn off release ASSERTs.<span class="line"><!----> - it doesn't seem like a correct debugging check. Reporter: when reporting errors I recommend double-checking ASSERT-based crashes as the bug might be the ASSERT itself. You can specify "dcheck_always_on = false" in Release builds to turn off release ASSERTs.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/angle/angle/+/3a6a0e910080d2544be3391b56e85bce1549bfc2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/angle/angle/+/3a6a0e910080d2544be3391b56e85bce1549bfc2"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/angle/angle/+/3a6a0e910080d2544be3391b56e85bce1549bfc2<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>3a6a0e910080d2544be3391b56e85bce1549bfc2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/3a6a0e910080d2544be3391b56e85bce1549bfc2"><!---->3a6a0e910080d2544be3391b56e85bce1549bfc2<!----></a><br>Author: Jamie Madill <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Jamie Madill &lt;<!----></span>jmadill@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:jmadill@chromium.org"><!---->jmadill@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Mon Aug 02 12:01:33 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Mon Aug 02 12:01:33 2021<!----></span><br><br>Remove ASSERT in computeRowPitch about row length.<span class="line"><!---->Remove ASSERT in computeRowPitch about row length.<!----></span><br><br>Compressed texture image uploads ignore unpack parameters. So it's<span class="line"><!---->Compressed texture image uploads ignore unpack parameters. So it's<!----></span><br>not an error if these parameters have non-default values. We just<span class="line"><!---->not an error if these parameters have non-default values. We just<!----></span><br>ignore them anyway. This ASSERT was causing a crash in some edge<span class="line"><!---->ignore them anyway. This ASSERT was causing a crash in some edge<!----></span><br>cases in debug and dcheck builds.<span class="line"><!---->cases in debug and dcheck builds.<!----></span><br><br>ASSERT introduced in <span class="line"><!---->ASSERT introduced in <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/348064<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/348064"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/348064<!----></a><br><br>Bug: chromium:1235031<span class="line"><!---->Bug: chromium:1235031<!----></span><br>Change-Id:         As this issue does not impact production builds, the VRP Panel declines to extend a reward for this report. Thank you for your efforts!<span class="line"><!---->As this issue does not impact production builds, the VRP Panel declines to extend a reward for this report.            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        }

      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>

        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

Replace to angle samples/hello_triangle/HelloTriangle.cpp with the attached HelloTriangle.cpp.<!----></span><br>2. build and execute to hello_triangle.exe<span class="line"><!---->2. build and execute to hello_triangle.exe<!----></span><br>3.<span class="line"><!---->3.<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br><br># Title<span class="line"><!----># Title<!----></span><br>    - ANGLE_CRASH call by glPixelStorei<span class="line"><!---->    - Crash in glCompressedTexImage2D by glPixelStorei<!----></span><br><br># Test Environment<span class="line"><!----># Test Environment<!----></span><br>    - commit<!----></span><br><br># Root Cause Analysis<span class="line"><!----># Root Cause Analysis<!----></span><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>bool ValidImageDataSize(const depth,<!----></span><br>                        GLenum format,<span class="line"><!---->                        GLenum format,<!----></span><br>                        GLenum type,<span *pixels,<!----></span><br>                        GLsizei imageSize)<span class="line"><!---->                        GLsizei imageSize)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br> context-&gt;getState().getTargetBuffer(BufferBinding::PixelUnpack);<!----></span><br>    if (pixelUnpackBuffer == nullptr && imageSize < 0)<span class="line"><!---->    if (pixelUnpackBuffer == nullptr &amp;&amp; imageSize &lt; 0)<!----></span><br>    {<span class="line"><!---->    {<!----></span><br>        // Checks are not required<span class="line"><!---->        // Checks are not required<!----></span><br>        return true;<span class="line"><!---->        return true;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br><br>    // ...the data would be unpacked from the buffer object such that the memory reads required<span class="line"><!---->    // ...the data would be unpacked from the buffer object such that the memory reads required<!----></span><br>    // would exceed the data store size.<span class="line"><!---->    // would exceed the data store size.<!----></span><br>    const InternalFormat &formatInfo = GetInternalFormatInfo(format, type);<span class="line"><!---->    const InternalFormat &amp;formatInfo = GetInternalFormatInfo(format, type);<!----></span><br>    ASSERT(formatInfo.internalFormat != GL_NONE);<span class="line"><!---->    ASSERT(formatInfo.internalFormat != GL_NONE);<!----></span><br>    const Extents size(width, height, depth);<span class="line"><!---->    const Extents size(width, height, depth);<!----></span><br>    const auto &unpack = context->getState().getUnpackState();<span class="line"><!---->    const auto &amp;unpack = context-&gt;getState().getUnpackState();<!----></span><br><br>    bool targetIs3D = texType == TextureType::_3D || texType == TextureType::_2DArray;<span class="line"><!---->    bool targetIs3D = texType == TextureType::_3D || texType == TextureType::_2DArray;<!----></span><br>    GLuint endByte  = 0;<span class="line"><!---->    GLuint endByte  = 0;<!----></span><br>    if &amp;endByte)) // [1]<!----></span><br>    {<span class="line"><!---->    {<!----></span><br>        context->validationError(GL_INVALID_OPERATION, kIntegerOverflow);<span class="line"><!----> class="line"><!---->    if (!computeRowPitch(formatType, size.width, state.alignment, state.rowLength, &amp;rowPitch)) //[2] state.rowLength == 0.<!----></span><br>    {<span class="line"><!---->    {<!----></span><br>        return false;<span class="line"><!---->        return false;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br><br>    GLuint depthPitch = 0;<span &amp;&amp; !computeDepthPitch(size.height, state.imageHeight, rowPitch, &amp;depthPitch))<!----></span><br>    {<span class="line"><!---->    {<!----></span><br>        return false;<span class="line"><!---->        return false;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>bool InternalFormat::computeRowPitch(GLenum formatType,<span class="line"><!---->bool InternalFormat::computeRowPitch(GLenum formatType,<!----></span><br>                                     GLsizei width,<span class="line"><!---->                                     GLsizei width,<!----></span><br>                                     GLint alignment,<span class="line"><!---->                                     GLint alignment,<!----></span><br>                                     GLint rowLength,<span class="line"><!---->                                     GLint rowLength,<!----></span><br>                                     GLuint *resultOut) const<span class="line"><!---->                                     GLuint *resultOut) const<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>    // Compressed images do not use pack/unpack parameters.<span class="line"><!---->    // Compressed images do not use pack/unpack parameters.<!----></span><br>    if (compressed)<span class="line"><!---->    if (compressed)<!----></span><br>    {<span class="line"><!---->    {<!----></span><br>        ASSERT(rowLength == 0); //[*] here, called ANGLE_CRASH() in ~LogMessage()<span class="line"><!---->        ASSERT(rowLength == 0); //[*] here, called ANGLE_CRASH() in ~LogMessage()<!----></span><br>        return computeCompressedImageSize(Extents(width, 1, 1), resultOut);<span class="line"><!---->        return computeCompressedImageSize(Extents(width, 1, 1), resultOut);<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br># Proof of Concept<span class="line"><!----># Proof of Concept<!----></span><br><br>trigger to this crash, i use `HelloTriangle.cpp`<span class="line"><!---->trigger to this crash, i use `HelloTriangle.cpp`<!----></span><br><br>Here is the `draw` method code snippet<span class="line"><!---->Here is the `draw` method code snippet<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>void draw() override<span class="line"><!---->void draw() override<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>    GLuint buffers1;<span class="line"><!---->    GLuint buffers1;<!----></span><br>    glGenBuffers(1, &buffers1);<span class="line"><!---->    glGenBuffers(1, &amp;buffers1);<!----></span><br>    glBindBuffer(0x88ec, 0x1);<span class="line"><!---->    glBindBuffer(0x88ec, 0x1);<!----></span><br><br>    glPixelStorei(0x00000cf2, 0x00000001);<span class="line"><!---->    glPixelStorei(0x00000cf2, 0x00000001);<!----></span><br>    glCompressedTexImage2D(GL_TEXTURE_2D,0x00000003,0x000083f1,0x00000100,0x00000100,0x00000000,0x00000001,0x00000000);<span class="line"><!---->    glCompressedTexImage2D(GL_TEXTURE_2D,0x00000003,0x000083f1,0x00000100,0x00000100,0x00000000,0x00000001,0x00000000);<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Did this work before? N/A <span class="line"><!---->Did this work before? N/A <!----></span><br><br>Chrome version: 92.0.4515.107  Channel: stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome version: 92.0.4515.107  Channel: stable<!----></span><br>OS Version: 10.0<span class="line"><!---->OS Version: 10.0<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1235031#c4">Comment 4<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Aug 2, 2021, 8:07 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1235031#c4">Comment 4<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Aug 2, 2021, 8:07 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Started
          (was: Assigned)

      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Started
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Thanks for the report! The crash is inside of a failing ASSERT call, which is only enabled in testing builds. I put in a CL that removes the ASSERT here: <span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report! The crash is inside of a failing ASSERT call, which is only enabled in testing builds. I put in a CL that removes the ASSERT here: <!----></span>http://crrev.com/c/3064986<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://crrev.com/c/3064986"><!---->http://crrev.com/c/3064986<!----></a> - it doesn't seem like a correct debugging check. Reporter: when reporting errors I recommend double-checking ASSERT-based crashes as the bug might be the ASSERT itself. You can specify "dcheck_always_on = false" in Release builds to turn off release ASSERTs.<span class="line"><!----> - it doesn't seem like a correct debugging check. Reporter: when reporting errors I recommend double-checking ASSERT-based crashes as the bug might be the ASSERT itself. You can specify "dcheck_always_on = false" in Release builds to turn off release ASSERTs.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>

          Comment 9<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1235031#c9">Comment 9<!----></a>

        for LitElement.

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>
    <mr-click-throughs></mr-click-throughs>

      UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/92.0.4515.107 Safari/537.36<span class="line"><!---->UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/92.0.4515.107 Safari/537.36<!----></span><br><br>Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>1. Replace to angle samples/hello_triangle/HelloTriangle.cpp with the attached HelloTriangle.cpp.<span class="line"><!---->1. Replace to angle samples/hello_triangle/HelloTriangle.cpp with the attached HelloTriangle.cpp.<!----></span><br>2. build and execute to hello_triangle.exe<span class="line"><!---->2. build and execute to hello_triangle.exe<!----></span><br>3.<span class="line"><!---->3.<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br><br># Title<span class="line"><!----># Title<!----></span><br>    - ANGLE_CRASH call by rowLength == 0<span class="line"><!---->    - ANGLE_CRASH call by rowLength == 0<!----></span><br># Summary<span class="line"><!----># Summary<!----></span><br>    - Crash in glCompressedTexImage2D by glPixelStorei<span class="line"><!---->    - Crash in glCompressedTexImage2D by glPixelStorei<!----></span><br><br># Test Environment<span class="line"><!----># Test Environment<!----></span><br>    - OS : window 10 64bit<span class="line"><!---->    - OS : window 10 64bit<!----></span><br>    - version : angle latest commit<span class="line"><!---->    - version : angle latest commit<!----></span><br><br># Root Cause Analysis<span class="line"><!----># Root Cause Analysis<!----></span><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>bool ValidImageDataSize(const Context *context,<span class="line"><!---->bool ValidImageDataSize(const Context *context,<!----></span><br>                        TextureType texType,<span class="line"><!---->                        TextureType texType,<!----></span><br>                        GLsizei width,<span class="line"><!---->                        GLsizei width,<!----></span><br>                        GLsizei height,<span class="line"><!---->                        GLsizei height,<!----></span><br>                        GLsizei depth,<span class="line"><!---->                        GLsizei depth,<!----></span><br>                        GLenum format,<span class="line"><!---->                        GLenum format,<!----></span><br>                        GLenum type,<span class="line"><!---->                        GLenum type,<!----></span><br>                        const void *pixels,<span class="line"><!---->                        const void *pixels,<!----></span><br>                        GLsizei imageSize)<span class="line"><!---->                        GLsizei imageSize)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>    Buffer *pixelUnpackBuffer = context->getState().getTargetBuffer(BufferBinding::PixelUnpack);<span class="line"><!---->    Buffer *pixelUnpackBuffer = context-&gt;getState().getTargetBuffer(BufferBinding::PixelUnpack);<!----></span><br>    if (pixelUnpackBuffer == nullptr && imageSize < 0)<span class="line"><!---->    if (pixelUnpackBuffer == nullptr &amp;&amp; imageSize &lt; 0)<!----></span><br>    {<span class="line"><!---->    {<!----></span><br>        // Checks are not required<span class="line"><!---->        // Checks are not required<!----></span><br>        return true;<span class="line"><!---->        return true;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br><br>    // ...the data would be unpacked from the buffer object such that the memory reads required<span class="line"><!---->    // ...the data would be unpacked from the buffer object such that the memory reads required<!----></span><br>    // would exceed the data store size.<span class="line"><!---->    // would exceed the data store size.<!----></span><br>    const InternalFormat &formatInfo = GetInternalFormatInfo(format, type);<span class="line"><!---->    const InternalFormat &amp;formatInfo = GetInternalFormatInfo(format, type);<!----></span><br>    ASSERT(formatInfo.internalFormat != GL_NONE);<span class="line"><!---->    ASSERT(formatInfo.internalFormat != GL_NONE);<!----></span><br>    const Extents size(width, height, depth);<span class="line"><!---->    const Extents size(width, height, depth);<!----></span><br>    const auto &unpack = context->getState().getUnpackState();<span class="line"><!---->    const auto &amp;unpack = context-&gt;getState().getUnpackState();<!----></span><br><br>    bool targetIs3D = texType == TextureType::_3D || texType == TextureType::_2DArray;<span class="line"><!---->    bool targetIs3D = texType == TextureType::_3D || texType == TextureType::_2DArray;<!----></span><br>    GLuint endByte  = 0;<span class="line"><!---->    GLuint endByte  = 0;<!----></span><br>    if (!formatInfo.computePackUnpackEndByte(type, size, unpack, targetIs3D, &endByte)) // [1]<span class="line"><!---->    if (!formatInfo.computePackUnpackEndByte(type, size, unpack, targetIs3D, &amp;endByte)) // [1]<!----></span><br>    {<span class="line"><!---->    {<!----></span><br>        context->validationError(GL_INVALID_OPERATION, kIntegerOverflow);<span class="line"><!---->        context-&gt;validationError(GL_INVALID_OPERATION, kIntegerOverflow);<!----></span><br>        return false;<span class="line"><!---->        return false;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>bool InternalFormat::computePackUnpackEndByte(GLenum formatType,<span class="line"><!---->bool InternalFormat::computePackUnpackEndByte(GLenum formatType,<!----></span><br>                                              const Extents &size,<span class="line"><!---->                                              const Extents &amp;size,<!----></span><br>                                              const PixelStoreStateBase &state,<span class="line"><!---->                                              const PixelStoreStateBase &amp;state,<!----></span><br>                                              bool is3D,<span class="line"><!---->                                              bool is3D,<!----></span><br>                                              GLuint *resultOut) const<span class="line"><!---->                                              GLuint *resultOut) const<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>    GLuint rowPitch = 0;<span class="line"><!---->    GLuint rowPitch = 0;<!----></span><br>    if (!computeRowPitch(formatType, size.width, state.alignment, state.rowLength, &rowPitch)) //[2] state.rowLength == 0.<span class="line"><!---->    if (!computeRowPitch(formatType, size.width, state.alignment, state.rowLength, &amp;rowPitch)) //[2] state.rowLength == 0.<!----></span><br>    {<span class="line"><!----> &amp;&amp; !computeDepthPitch(size.height, state.imageHeight, rowPitch, &amp;depthPitch))<!----></span><br>    {<span class="line"><!---->    {<!----></span><br>        return false;<span const<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>    // Compressed images do not use pack/unpack parameters.<span class="line"><!---->    // Compressed images do not use         Thanks for the report! The crash is inside of a failing ASSERT call, which is only enabled in testing builds. I put in a CL that removes the ASSERT here: <span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report! The crash is inside of a failing ASSERT call, which is only enabled in testing builds. I put in a CL that removes the ASSERT here: <!----></span>http://crrev.com/c/3064986<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://crrev.com/c/3064986"><!---->http://crrev.com/c/3064986<!----></a> - it doesn't seem like a correct debugging check. Reporter: when reporting errors I recommend double-checking ASSERT-based crashes as the bug might be the ASSERT itself. You can specify "dcheck_always_on = false" in Release builds to turn off release ASSERTs.<span class="line"><!----> - it doesn't seem like a correct debugging check. Reporter: when reporting errors I recommend double-checking ASSERT-based crashes as the bug might be the ASSERT itself. You can specify "dcheck_always_on = false" in Release builds to turn off release ASSERTs.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

            Issue 1235031: Crash in glCompressedTexImage2D by glPixelStorei
          <h1>

          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      sjh...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/1969631125" title="sjh...@gmail.com"><!---->sjh...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      sjh...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->sjh...@gmail.com<!----></span>

      Sat, Jul 31, 2021, 8:21 AM EDT

unpacked from the buffer object such that the memory reads required<span class="line"><!---->    // ...the data would be unpacked from the buffer object such that the memory reads         Thanks for the report! The crash is inside of a failing ASSERT call, which is only enabled in testing builds. I put in a CL that removes the ASSERT here: <span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report! The crash is inside of a failing ASSERT call, which is only enabled in testing builds. I put in a CL that removes the ASSERT here: <!----></span>http://crrev.com/c/3064986<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://crrev.com/c/3064986"><!---->http://crrev.com/c/3064986<!----></a> - it doesn't seem like a correct debugging check. Reporter: when reporting errors I recommend double-checking ASSERT-based crashes as the bug might be the ASSERT itself. You can specify "dcheck_always_on = false" in Release builds to turn off release ASSERTs.<span class="line"><!----> - it doesn't seem like a correct debugging check. Reporter: when reporting errors I recommend double-checking ASSERT-based crashes as the bug might be the ASSERT itself. You can specify "dcheck_always_on = false" in Release builds to turn off release ASSERTs.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

So it's<span class="line"><!---->Compressed texture image uploads ignore unpack parameters. So it's<!----></span><br>not an error if these parameters have non-default values. We just<span class="line"><!---->not an error if these parameters have non-default values. We just<!----></span><br>ignore them anyway. This ASSERT was causing a crash in some edge<span class="line"><!---->ignore them anyway.       UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/92.0.4515.107 Safari/537.36<span class="line"><!---->UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/92.0.4515.107 Safari/537.36<!----></span><br><br>Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>1. Replace to angle samples/hello_triangle/HelloTriangle.cpp with the attached HelloTriangle.cpp.<span class="line"><!---->1. Replace to angle samples/hello_triangle/HelloTriangle.cpp with the attached HelloTriangle.cpp.<!----></span><br>2. build and execute to hello_triangle.exe<span class="line"><!---->2. build and execute to hello_triangle.exe<!----></span><br>3.<span class="line"><!---->3.<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br><br># Title<span class="line"><!----># Title<!----></span><br>    - ANGLE_CRASH call by rowLength == 0<span class="line"><!---->    - ANGLE_CRASH call by rowLength == 0<!----></span><br># Summary<span class="line"><!----># Summary<!----></span><br>    - Crash in glCompressedTexImage2D by glPixelStorei<span class="line"><!---->    - Crash in glCompressedTexImage2D by glPixelStorei<!----></span><br><br># Test Environment<span class="line"><!----># Test Environment<!----></span><br>    - OS : window 10 64bit<span class="line"><!---->    - OS : window 10 64bit<!----></span><br>    - version : angle latest commit<span class="line"><!---->    - version : angle latest commit<!----></span><br><br># Root Cause Analysis<span class="line"><!----># Root Cause Analysis<!----></span><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>bool ValidImageDataSize(const Context *context,<span class="line"><!---->bool ValidImageDataSize(const Context *context,<!----></span><br>                        TextureType texType,<span class="line"><!---->                        TextureType texType,<!----></span><br>                        GLsizei width,<span class="line"><!---->                        GLsizei width,<!----></span><br>                        GLsizei height,<span class="line"><!---->                        GLsizei height,<!----></span><br>                        GLsizei depth,<span class="line"><!---->                        GLsizei depth,<!----></span><br>                        GLenum format,<span class="line"><!---->                        GLenum format,<!----></span><br>                        GLenum type,<span class="line"><!---->                        GLenum type,<!----></span><br>                        const void *pixels,<span class="line"><!---->                        const void *pixels,<!----></span><br>                        GLsizei imageSize)<span class="line"><!---->                        GLsizei imageSize)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>    Buffer *pixelUnpackBuffer = context->getState().getTargetBuffer(BufferBinding::PixelUnpack);<span class="line"><!---->    Buffer *pixelUnpackBuffer = context-&gt;getState().getTargetBuffer(BufferBinding::PixelUnpack);<!----></span><br>    if (pixelUnpackBuffer == nullptr && imageSize < 0)<span class="line"><!---->    if (pixelUnpackBuffer == nullptr &amp;&amp; imageSize &lt; 0)<!----></span><br>    {<span class="line"><!---->    {<!----></span><br>        // Checks are not required<span class="line"><!---->        // Checks are not required<!----></span><br>        return true;<span class="line"><!---->        return true;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br><br>    // ...the data would be unpacked from the buffer object such that the memory reads required<span class="line"><!---->    // ...the data would be unpacked from the buffer object such that the memory reads         Thanks for the report! The crash is inside of a failing ASSERT call, which is only enabled in testing builds. I put in a CL that removes the ASSERT here: <span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report! The crash is inside of a failing ASSERT call, which is only enabled in testing builds. I put in a CL that removes the ASSERT here: <!----></span>http://crrev.com/c/3064986<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://crrev.com/c/3064986"><!---->http://crrev.com/c/3064986<!----></a> - it doesn't seem like a correct debugging check. Reporter: when reporting errors I recommend double-checking ASSERT-based crashes as the bug might be the ASSERT itself. You can specify "dcheck_always_on = false" in Release builds to turn off release ASSERTs.<span class="line"><!----> - it doesn't seem like a correct debugging check. Reporter: when reporting errors I recommend double-checking ASSERT-based crashes as the bug might be the ASSERT itself. You can specify "dcheck_always_on = false" in Release builds to turn off release ASSERTs.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

<!----></span>syoussefi@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:syoussefi@google.com"><!---->syoussefi@google.com<!----></a> on the revert to ensure that a human<span class="line"><!----> on the revert to ensure that a human<!----></span><br>is aware of the problem.<span class="line"><!---->is aware of the problem.<!----></span><br><br>To report a problem with the       UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/92.0.4515.107 Safari/537.36<span class="line"><!---->UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/92.0.4515.107 Safari/537.36<!----></span><br><br>Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>1.         Thanks for the report! The crash is inside of a failing ASSERT call, which is only enabled in testing builds. I put in a CL that removes the ASSERT here: <span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report! The crash is inside of a failing ASSERT call, which is only enabled in testing builds. I put in a CL that removes the ASSERT here: <!----></span>http://crrev.com/c/3064986<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://crrev.com/c/3064986"><!---->http://crrev.com/c/3064986<!----></a> - it doesn't seem like a correct debugging check. Reporter: when reporting errors I recommend double-checking ASSERT-based crashes as the bug might be the ASSERT itself. You can specify "dcheck_always_on = false" in Release builds to turn off release ASSERTs.<span class="line"><!----> - it doesn't seem like a correct debugging check. Reporter: when reporting errors I recommend double-checking ASSERT-based crashes as the bug might be the ASSERT itself. You can specify "dcheck_always_on = false" in Release builds to turn off release ASSERTs.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        Thanks for the report! The crash is inside of a failing ASSERT call, which is only enabled in testing builds. I put in a CL that removes the ASSERT here: <span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report! The crash is inside of a failing ASSERT call, which is only enabled in testing builds. I put in a CL that removes the ASSERT here: <!----></span>http://crrev.com/c/3064986<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://crrev.com/c/3064986"><!---->http://crrev.com/c/3064986<!----></a> - it doesn't seem like a correct debugging check. Reporter: when reporting errors I recommend double-checking ASSERT-based crashes as the bug might be the ASSERT itself. You can specify "dcheck_always_on = false" in Release builds to turn off release ASSERTs.<span class="line"><!----> - it doesn't seem like a correct debugging check. Reporter: when reporting errors I recommend double-checking ASSERT-based crashes as the bug might be the ASSERT itself. You can specify "dcheck_always_on = false" in Release builds to turn off release ASSERTs.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      </style>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
